website_summaries.verdict: A comprehensive guide that is easy to follow and a good size to take into the field.
pros: Easy to follow descriptions include environment, field marks, similar rocks and minerals, and variations of color or crystal form
Includes a section on how to collect minerals
cons: Some felt that this focused too much on minerals, and not enough on "average" rocks

customer_reviews.title: A Great Book for Budding Geologists, or for Guys Who Have Hearts Made of Stone
customer_reviews.text: I got this as a gift for my ex-boyfriend while we were still dating. He sucked, but this book rocked. (Haha, get it? "Rock"ed?)* *In hindsight, my sense of humor may have been the reason why our relationship ended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews and had hoped that this book would allow my kids to identify the many different kinds of rocks we find in our summer trips. The bulk of the book focuses on minerals (crystals) and there isn’t a lot of options for identifying the many different types of rocks that we find on our vacations. We have a rock tumbler and this book is not suited for that type of information.
customer_reviews.author: Philip Heileson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful
customer_reviews.text: I used to get these books every year for my birthday from my parents. I looked through them countless times. I love the insects and arachnids one the best, since I love bugs! Because of the fond memories and that we have a collection of them already, I bought this for my husband for his birthday. He loves rocks and minerals and LOVED looking through this! I always catch him looking through it, and he really enjoys it. I am really happy with this purchase. Good price, GREAT pictures, and lots of information. These Audubon books always feel like they are made well also. The cover, the pages, the pictures, everything is great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Emily N.

customer_reviews.title: Great Book for Rock and Mineral Hounds
customer_reviews.text: This is the best book about rocks and minerals. It's a must have for rock hounds and fossil hunters. We all need to identify the rocks, do they have minerals or fossils in them? These are just the best series of book for the natural world out there I can recommend all of them to people. The price is great, it's a good savings over book store prices.
customer_reviews.author: Mema

customer_reviews.title: This is a very good book by none other than the Audubon society
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good book by none other than the Audubon society. Clear images and easy to follow descriptions. Very handy book to have either at home or to bring along in the field. The book size is also very handy as it is not to large, but fits easily in any backpack.
customer_reviews.author: A. kolsrud

customer_reviews.title: Book o rocks. Solid.
customer_reviews.text: This is a good Field guide with a good set of color photos for ID. Purchased for my daughter, who is an ametuer rockhounds. I've used this brand of Field guides for other groups of plants/animals for years, and the are the best available for your general non-scientist. You could carry around a 300page text book at 4x the weight, but these guides do a great job.
customer_reviews.author: anonymous smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Reference!
customer_reviews.text: This book is a great reference for those times where you find yourself in a natural history museum and they haven't labeled their show quality exhibits of minerals and gems, if however you are trying to figure out what the pretty pebble you found out on a glacial till plain is, you'll be sorely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Burk J. Rhodes

customer_reviews.title: and as always they don't disappoint. Good
customer_reviews.text: My parents had several of these guides on different subjects when I was a kid so I was already familiar with them. I had to pick one up for a budding rock hunting hobby, and as always they don't disappoint. Good, detailed information, and a section of each book is dedicated to high quality color photos to supplement the drawings.
customer_reviews.author: BiffTop Contributor: Guitars

customer_reviews.title: Content extraordinary.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book as a gift, so I don't know how they will like it. But he should, because there is a extensive information in it -- many color pictures with detailed information about each; what tools are needed for rock collecting; how to display and catalog. The content is super, but the book itself is slightly disappointing. That's the only reason I gave it a "4." The book is stiff and the pages are hard to pull apart and look at. There should be more blank paper space between the binding and the printing. It won't open flat now, but might after further use.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Shanta

customer_reviews.title: the book is easy to follow
customer_reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend use this so much! The pictures are clear, the book is easy to follow, and the information is not written so that you can't understand it. I have other field guides by the National Audubon Society and this one did not fall short of my expectations. Great Product, would purchase again for any rock lover!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: I was very satisfied with the book's condition
customer_reviews.text: I was unsure about buying a used book online . After receiving it , I was very satisfied with the book's condition . I used to own this book , but over the years it was either lost or given away , so I knew the content of the book . I received it promptly and it was in very good condition as advertised . I'm glad I purchased it and would recommend it to any " rock hound " .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for Moms who work at Trader Joes
customer_reviews.text: I have no clue what this book is about, but my mom seems to like it. She usually donates her books once read, but she has kept this one on her shelf. She's in her late 50s and it kind of a hippy. I'm sure there's flowers pressed inside the pages by now.
customer_reviews.author: Ella_RN

customer_reviews.title: Comprehensive, THE BEST
customer_reviews.text: This book is better than good or excellent, more like new; whereas other rock and mineral books fall short in the number of illustrations, this book does not fall short. It has to be, in my opinion, the most comprehensive rock and mineral book ever published.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: Compact informative detailed and well illustrated with photos for the amateur geologist. A helpful guide and not expensive and very handy, easily fits any field bag.
customer_reviews.author: Dominic Hofer

customer_reviews.title: It was recommended by a professor and I have been told by ...
customer_reviews.text: This is well organized and has been very helpful as a geology student. It was recommended by a professor and I have been told by upperclassmen that it is an extremely helpful tool. If you are looking for a guide as an amateur or hobbyist then this is also helpful as it breaks the info down well and in many ways. I plan to keep this book throughout my career.
customer_reviews.author: Corbin

customer_reviews.title: Expert level reference tool
customer_reviews.text: This is NOT a beginners book. I wanted a book on agates and this is way too complicated. If I had an advanced degree in this subject than I’m sure this would be a great reference tool. Unfortunately it was not what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A good inclusion in one's library, or two's.
customer_reviews.text: With the instructions in the first chapter this can be a great learning tool. A good addition to the small library of Audubon Society's identification manuals. A must have for hobbyists and SHTFers.
customer_reviews.author: Sir Blabs a Lot

customer_reviews.title: Teacher's gift
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a junior high science teacher and loves earth sciences. She has been eyeing this book for a while and was thrilled when she opened it on Christmas. Quick shipping.
customer_reviews.author: miczthom

customer_reviews.title: Not book pictured
customer_reviews.text: Not at all the book I ordered. The front is totally different and it’s a much older version. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen Strain

customer_reviews.title: Best book when you need to start about learning rocks
customer_reviews.text: Another book that I bought for my son to learn about rocks for his school project. This is the latest book I bought so far, and I've to say, it is the best book to let kids begin with their 'rock-study'. Clear explanation of how to distinguish between different rocks by color, shape, luster, etc. Great pictures, with good explanation. One minor point from my point of view, that it is just focused on US rocks. But that shouldn't hamper when you just want to start with this subject.
customer_reviews.author: Dutch Andre in the US

customer_reviews.title: Amazing
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my nephew to get him interested in a new hobby!! Very colorful and detailed book!
customer_reviews.author: SLG

customer_reviews.title: A rock hounds bible...
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful field guide that sorts minerals by color and then subdivides them by crystal habit. Lots of beautifully photographed plates, and explains the mineralogical characteristics of all the specimens. Very easy book to read and enjoy, which will help you learn about or classify your finds. Might not be the best beginners book. 800 pages!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Oceanfront

customer_reviews.title: Recommended for amateur rock hounds
customer_reviews.text: Although I agree with some reviews that this book is dated, I’ve always liked it. I am replacing the one I lost in a flood. So glad to be able to find this again. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Ari

customer_reviews.title: Great gift
customer_reviews.text: Given as a birthday gift to a friend who is an avid rock hunter. He was so happy about it! It's a beautiful book, and the standard guide for rock nerds. Very pleased, all approved.
customer_reviews.author: Randall Bales

customer_reviews.title: Great book for my needs
customer_reviews.text: Book was in perfect condition & exactly what I needed for identification of rocks & minerals i have been collecting
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: Awesome book, provides much better pictures than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Awesome book, provides much better pictures than I expected. Kinda hard to following, but that's from a person that's new to rock collecting and immersing themselves head first into the field. It's jammed full of facts, observational descriptions and chemical properties (for the chemistry nerds) as well as region indicators. My only suggestion for this book would be more details on where minerals can be found, but that would make this book super intense.
customer_reviews.author: TheOrdinaryHiker

customer_reviews.title: Great guide
customer_reviews.text: A great guide for the rock and mineral nut in your house. Great illustrations and distribution charts- terrific.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen Salniker

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Field Guide
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this book to take on our family Jeep adventures when we stop to look at rocks. It’s the perfect size (not too big...can fit in our glovebox). The book is layed out beautifully and the color pictures are amazing and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Greatest
customer_reviews.text: I love these books,everything you want to learn and then some. Will buy again
customer_reviews.author: King and Jeannie

customer_reviews.title: Right fine book.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect book. In god condition. Very informative. Standard format of the Audubon society.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Kelson

customer_reviews.title: Great Tool for Rock Hounds
customer_reviews.text: All around encompassing book. Has a leather like cover, is small enough to not be a problem to take along, very excellent book.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Jo

customer_reviews.title: Great guide
customer_reviews.text: Makes identifying rocks easy and its full of information on a range of topics. Rock topics, obviously.
customer_reviews.author: douglas graham

customer_reviews.title: This is an excellent book for the novice collector or for someone
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent book for the novice collector or for someone, like me, who has been collecting rocks and gems for several decades. The pictures help to make identification of specimens easy. This is an excellent field guide that can be carried with you. I have used this guide for several years, and now I have purchased a copy for my young granddaughter. She will enjoy it for years to come.
customer_reviews.author: SSaunders

customer_reviews.title: Prospectors must have
customer_reviews.text: Really well illustrated & clear colorful pictures. Very informative book. Husband absolutely loves it. Takes it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: tonia berning

customer_reviews.title: Painfully slow shipping.
customer_reviews.text: Product was fine,however this is a small book that should not require 10 days to arrive,Period.
customer_reviews.author: Danny C.

customer_reviews.title: Super Book
customer_reviews.text: I've always been a RockHound and have gotten my wife interested in rock and gem hunting. This book is a real help for anyone to identify what you have found. Sometimes it's hard to identify what you've found when it's in the rough, but this book shows (in most cases) what the stone or gem looks like in the rough and also what it looks like after it's been worked on. This book is for anyone from the casual rockhound to anyone thinking about going in to Lapidary field.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hunter

customer_reviews.title: National Audubon Society Field Guide to North American Rocks and Minerals
customer_reviews.text: This book is full of pictures and descriptions of North American rocks and minerals. I was very impressed by how well the rocks and minerals are described and pictured. It is extremely well done and very thorough. Highly recommend and a good way to start a young person interested in rocks and minerals as long as there is an adult to help them understand some of the wording.
customer_reviews.author: Shopping Diva

customer_reviews.title: They liked my book so much that I just had to ...
customer_reviews.text: This was for my grandsons who live in Washington state. They liked my book so much that I just had to get this for them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Pictures and Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as an addition to my set of Audubon Field Guides. Great pictures and easy to use, just like all their guides.
customer_reviews.author: Hermit Writer

customer_reviews.title: RI has amny kids of rocks and minerals and this ...
customer_reviews.text: RI has amny kids of rocks and minerals and this compact but complete book allows me to recognize what I found!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great book!
customer_reviews.text: I love the Audubon series of books, I'm very pleased with all the information packed inside!
customer_reviews.author: Karina

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful book!
customer_reviews.text: I'm working as a tour guide in a small town in Alaska this summer, and have taken up the hobby of collecting and identifying rocks in my spare time. This book has been extremely helpful so far in identification, and all around an interesting read. The colorful images and descriptions make it easy for an amateur to learn. Great book for any enthusiast's collection. I've looked at other field guides before, and would recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie J

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for rockhounding!
customer_reviews.text: Spot on condition description by seller and I received before delivery date. Perfect size book to take with you on rockhounding trips but I am going to make a cover for it for more protection.
customer_reviews.author: Tina Gordon

customer_reviews.title: beautiful pictures, informative
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 8-year old son whose current obsession is rocks and minerals. He loves this book! He has used this book for reference almost daily. I think he has almost the entire book memorized. Very thorough, beautiful pictures, informative. Great gift for any rock lover!
customer_reviews.author: Christa S

customer_reviews.title: Great for a coffee table!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be better for a coffee table! looks great and has enough information to start a conversation! very hard to find on here with all the crystal healing books but glad I did!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas jeske

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm in love with this book! It's so informative, and has a ton of reference photos.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Ciffone

customer_reviews.title: Better to have rock samples
customer_reviews.text: Better to have rock samples, but the book is good if you know about what your looking for on a rock trip.
customer_reviews.author: William C. Weaver

customer_reviews.title: this is still the best resource. My first one was from 1982
customer_reviews.text: As a geologist, this is still the best resource. My first one was from 1982!
customer_reviews.author: R. Holland

customer_reviews.title: If it's in nature Audubon is in the field.
customer_reviews.text: I'd find it hard to say something bad about the many Audubon Handbooks that I have. Rocks and Minerals in North America is another good guide. No matter your level of experience this book can help you.
customer_reviews.author: One D Plus Two

customer_reviews.title: Excellent book
customer_reviews.text: Everything was above my expectations. This book is well made for taking with you to wherever you go and the seller was precise about shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Druella

customer_reviews.title: A classic
customer_reviews.text: This is such a great series. I sent this to my grandson so that he could add this book to his collection of Audubon field guides.
customer_reviews.author: Jeanie K

customer_reviews.title: Great books always...
customer_reviews.text: These are the gold standard in field guides as far as I'm concerned. I got this book for my great nephew who is into gems and minerals, and he absolutely loves it. The pictures are brightly colored and the information is easy to read but very informative. You can't go wrong with any of these guides.
customer_reviews.author: Wileerex

customer_reviews.title: Great reference source
customer_reviews.text: EXCELLENT!!! Great reference - for pebble pups or exploring types!!! Great color plates, easy to use guide to identifying rocks and minerals.
customer_reviews.author: one4outdoorfun

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT BOOK
customer_reviews.text: Wow, this book has it all, by far the best field book on rocks and minerals i have ever seen, i would highly recommend this book to all rock hounds and non rock hounds and up and comers, EXCELLENT book here
customer_reviews.author: dave wilson

customer_reviews.title: Best Field Guide Available!!
customer_reviews.text: This book is the best that I have been able to find. Excellent field guide with great descriptions and photographs of all specimens.
customer_reviews.author: New eagle

customer_reviews.title: Fast Shipping
customer_reviews.text: It only took a day to get here, I didn’t even pay extra for shipping. Hubby love the book!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth bailey

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: the boyscout loved it, carries it with him, easier than bringing rocks home.
customer_reviews.author: Rolf

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I've never been disappointed with a National Audubon Society book. They are all great.
customer_reviews.author: L. Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted in a rock book. I'll find a rock that looks interesting and pick it up, but I can never figure out what it is - since I know nothing about the subject. This book is great because I can start with "well, it's pink"...
customer_reviews.author: Trudy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Great book. As I live near Rockhound State Park in Deming, New Mexico I will be putting this book to good use later this year when we take our grandchildren hunting treasures.
customer_reviews.author: Sian Offutt

customer_reviews.title: A lot of mineral info
customer_reviews.text: You can always count on these books to be great ID guides
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Thornton

customer_reviews.title: Great book, awesome pictures! One to hold onto for life
customer_reviews.text: We bought this book for our 7 year old daughter is LOVES anything to do with Rocks/Minerals/Crystals. She loves that the pictures are organized by the colors of the rocks/minerals. This is a great reference book and will help her identify the rocks/minerals she finds.
customer_reviews.author: NomersMcBorg

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Resource
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent reference with great colored pictures on rocks and minerals and their properties. It's also small enough to take with you on excursions.
customer_reviews.author: CJ

customer_reviews.title: Great help!
customer_reviews.text: Very thorough in information. It was more than I needed. But good reference for identifying stones and rocks. Pictures are nicely done.
customer_reviews.author: Artistmom5

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: A good product that came as described,good price and it shipped on time... very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: D.Dixon

customer_reviews.title: Helpful to have as a basic reference
customer_reviews.text: I'm a geology student and used it in my Mineralogy class and it was a great reference book for most of the minerals in the lab. It's small and easy to take with you when you go out and about in the field, just an overall nice book to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Nice book
customer_reviews.text: Nice book but would’ve liked the Rocks together with information not separated.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great reference book!
customer_reviews.text: I used this book in high school to help prepare for a Science Olympiad, and also to help study for my earth science class. It is comprehensive, clear, and just one of the best references I've ever used. I would recommend this to anyone interested in geology or learning to identify rocks and minerals, or who needs to learn for a class. I will be purchasing several more National Audubon Society Field Guides because of my experience with this one.
customer_reviews.author: TheWanderingGazelle

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your books on rocks and minerals of North America
customer_reviews.text: An excellent book of reference for anyone who enjoys identifying rocks and minerals in North America
customer_reviews.author: Request86

customer_reviews.title: Nice colored pictures
customer_reviews.text: Very, very detailed. Found, for me, hard to understand. Nice colored pictures. Just wanted a not so in-depth book, I'm a beginner at agate hunting. Will keep it for when I become more advanced.
customer_reviews.author: marilyn

customer_reviews.title: This is the one I was waiting for!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best book I have found for helping to identify the rocks and minerals that we got on a trip. Now I can get them ready for tumbling and not worry about mixing the wrong levels of hardness. This was the best book I found so far.
customer_reviews.author: Irma Rose Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Good book
customer_reviews.text: This is a good book for the novice collector or gem hunter. Detailed pictures help identify what you are looking at.
customer_reviews.author: trisha

customer_reviews.title: Little let down
customer_reviews.text: Not as great as I thought it would be. Not great pictures for field identification.
customer_reviews.author: Candij

customer_reviews.title: Center work
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this book as a reference book for center activities for my elementary students. Excellent pictures and information. Children could use this book with a little instruction on how the book worked to find data.
customer_reviews.author: Sheryl S.

customer_reviews.title: very detailed
customer_reviews.text: this is a very nice book, it has several images of different types of minerals that are good quality pictures with guides to show they type of minerals and color. this book is very informative

customer_reviews.title: Great Price!
customer_reviews.text: The book arrived in much better condition than I expected at this price!

customer_reviews.text: I've been needing this book for a long time. So happy I finally ordered it!

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars

customer_reviews.text: This is a well written and nicely photographed book, but it is focused more on crystals (which are ultra rare in many areas) and not rocks as I'd hoped. Rocks are mentioned, but there is less on that.
